definition: at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to meet/to encounter/to treat/to receive/opportunity/chance
surname Yu
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Suioueran life can be, and must adhere to in life.
sentences.chinese: 生活可以随遇而安，而生命中必须有所坚持。

sentences.english: The bitter fleabane in the wind is a typical drifting plant.
sentences.chinese: 那些风中轻飘的飞蓬，是植物界随遇而安的典型。

sentences.english: But a life of beauty does have a fixed rule, which is to feel satisfied with your present.
sentences.chinese: 但是，美丽人生的一条铁律，就是随遇而安。

sentences.english: People with an external locus of control think that everything that happens to them is fate.
sentences.chinese: 随遇而安的人会认为一切事情都是命中注定。

sentences.english: Anyhow, decorate meet the person with an an idealist happy-go-lucky wear.
sentences.chinese: 总之，装修会把一个理想主义者磨成随遇而安的人。

sentences.english: Use of willing attitude, a happy-go-lucky life.
sentences.chinese: 用心甘情愿的态度，过随遇而安的生活。

sentences.english: A lot of Bombay people have a chalta hai attitude.
sentences.chinese: 许多孟买人都有“随遇而安”的生活态度。

sentences.english: Often a valley boasted no inn at all, and climbers found shelter wherever they could.
sentences.chinese: 山谷里常常没有小客栈，登山者只好随遇而安。
从今以后，像蒲公英一样，随遇而安。

sentences.english: Paul was happy-go-lucky, but he grew up fast.
sentences.chinese: 保罗总是随遇而安，不过他很快长大。

definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
satisfied with what one has (idiom)
to be content with what one is
not to become attached to material things, not to pity oneself
pinyin: bu4 yi3 wu4 xi3 , bu4 yi3 ji3 bei1

definition: optimistic/sanguine/generous/magnanimous/open-minded
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
living a simple life

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
free and at ease/natural/unconstrained
to take things philosophically
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
